sentence.Network_en: Carl slipped a disc in his back while warming up.
sentence.Network_cn: 热身时卡尔腰椎间盘不慎错位了。

sentence.Network_en: Getting Hollywood's latest films released on laser-disc has also helped.
sentence.Network_cn: 通过激光视盘发行好莱坞最新电影也起到了一定作用。

sentence.Network_en: Today's floppy disc drives are tolerant of poor quality discs.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在的软驱对质量低劣的软盘也能读取。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (originally referring to the seemingly flat round form of the sun or moon): from French disque or Latin discus (see discus)

entry.def: A disc is a flat, circular shape or object.

example.ex: Most shredding machines are based on a revolving disc fitted with replaceable blades.
example.tran: 大多数粉碎机都是基于一个装有可替换刀片的旋转圆盘来实现作业的。

entry.def: A disc is one of the thin, circular pieces of cartilage which separates the bones in your back.

example.ex: I had slipped a disc and was frozen in a spasm of pain.
example.tran: 我有一个椎间盘错位了，疼得我动弹不得。

entry.def: A disc is a record that you play on a record player.

example.ex: This disc includes the piano sonata in C minor.
example.tran: 这张唱片包括了 C小调的钢琴奏鸣曲。

means.word_mean: 1. sound recording consisting of a disc with continuous grooves; formerly used to reproduce music by rotating while a phonograph needle tracked in the grooves
2. something with a round shape like a flat circular plate
3. (computer science) a memory device consisting of a flat disk covered with a magnetic coating on which information is stored
